snippet: Two days with 10 men who left Central America in early November to embark on an exhausting journey, made riskier by the Mexican authorities’ crackdown on migrants.
abstract: Crackdown by Mexican authorities on Central American migrants passing through country to reach United States has done little to stem flow of migrants and has only made journey for migrants even more dangerous; migrants are forced to take riskier routes than those taken before crackdown, leaving them vulnerable to gangs and corrupt police officers.

byline.contributor: Paulina Villegas contributed reporting from Chahuites, Mexico.

lead_paragraph: Two days with 10 men who left Central America in early November to embark on an exhausting journey, made riskier by the Mexican authorities’ crackdown on migrants.

headline.main: Step by Step on a Desperate Trek by Migrants Through Mexico
headline.print_headline: For Migrants, a Riskier Road in Mexico
